required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adefovir Dipivoxil In Compensated Chronic Hepatitis B Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III Study of Adefovir Dipivoxil Tablets in Patients With Compensated Chronic Hepatitis B -Comparative Study Against Lamivudine-

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to compare the efficacy and safety of adefovir dipivoxil 10 mg with lamivudine 100 mg in Japanese patients with compensated chronic hepatitis B over 52-week periods.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA at Week 52

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HBV DNA Loss (<400 Copies/mL) at Week 52
Time to Onset of HBV DNA Loss (< 400 Copies/mL)
Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B e Antigen (HBeAg) Loss at Week 52
Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B e Antigen/Antibody (HBeAg/Ab) Seroconversion at Week 52
Time to Onset of HBeAg Loss
Time to Onset of HBeAg/Ab Seroconversion
Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B s Antigen (HBsAg) Loss at Week 52
Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B s Antigen/ Antibody (HBsAg/Ab) Seroconversion at Week 52
Mean Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Level at Week 52
Percentage of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Normalization at Week 52
Time to Onset of ALT Normalization
Rate of Emergence of Resistant Virus at Week 52

intervention.description: Subjects took one LAM 100mg tablet orally once daily and one ADV placebo tablet orally once daily.
Subjects took one ADV 10mg tablet orally once daily and one LAM placebo tablet orally once daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Have compensated chronic hepatitis B.
- Have not been treated with anti HBV agents with antiproliferative activity against. However, previous Interferon (IFN) therapy is permitted.
- Ability to read, understand, and sign the informed consent.
- Have a positive serum HBV-DNA >= 1,000,000 copies/mL and ALT level 50-500 U/L
Exclusion criteria:
- Having or suspected of having liver cancer.
- Co-infected with Hepatitis C virus (HCV) or Human Immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
- Autoimmune hepatitis.
- Received any previous transplantation or having a plan for any transplantation.
- Existence of any serious complication, except hepatitis B.

group.description: ADV 10 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

group.title: Lamivudine (LAM)
group.description: LAM 100 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA at Week 52
outcome.description: Change from baseline was the difference of the HBV DNA copy numbers (log10) in serum collected by blood draw between baseline and Week 52
outcome.population: Per Protocol Set (PPS): participants in the Full Analysis Set (all subjects who entered the study, received at least one dose of investigational product, and had at least one efficacy assessment after the treatment initiation) population with no major protocol violations

group.title: Adefovir (ADV)
group.description: ADV 10 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

group.title: Lamivudine (LAM)
group.description: LAM 100 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA at Week 52
measure.description: Change from baseline was the difference of the HBV DNA copy numbers (log10) in serum collected by blood draw between baseline and Week 52
measure.population: Per Protocol Set (PPS): participants in the Full Analysis Set (all subjects who entered the study, received at least one dose of investigational product, and had at least one efficacy assessment after the treatment initiation) population with no major protocol violations

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: This is a Non-inferiority Analysis with the margin of -1.0.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With HBV DNA Loss (<400 Copies/mL) at Week 52
outcome.description: The percentages of participants with an HBV DNA level in serum of less than 400 copies/mL, which is the lower limit of detection (HBV DNA loss) at Week 52

group.title: Adefovir (ADV)
group.description: ADV 10 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

group.title: Lamivudine (LAM)
group.description: LAM 100 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With HBV DNA Loss (<400 Copies/mL) at Week 52
measure.description: The percentages of participants with an HBV DNA level in serum of less than 400 copies/mL, which is the lower limit of detection (HBV DNA loss) at Week 52

outcome.title: Time to Onset of HBV DNA Loss (< 400 Copies/mL)
outcome.description: Time to onset of an HBV DNA level in serum of less than 400 copies/mL was summarized using the Kaplan-Meier method. Regarding the Measured Values, the median time to onset and its upper limit for the ADV group and the upper limit of the median time to onset for the LAM group are non-estimable because they are not observed until the end of the study. The lower limit of the median time to onset for the ADV and LAM groups are 36.0 and 20.0, respectively. The median time to onset for the LAM group is 28.0

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B e Antigen (HBeAg) Loss at Week 52
outcome.description: Participants with loss of Hepatitis B e antigen (HBeAg) in serum collected by blood draw: Cheminoluminescent Immuno Assay (CLIA) method
outcome.population: PPS: participants who were positive for HBeAg at baseline

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B e Antigen/Antibody (HBeAg/Ab) Seroconversion at Week 52
outcome.description: Participants with loss of Hepatitis B e antigen (HBeAg) and positive for anti-Hepatitis B e antibody (HBeAb) in serum collected by blood draw: CLIA method
outcome.population: PPS: participants who were positive for HBeAg and negative for HBeAb at baseline

outcome.title: Time to Onset of HBeAg Loss
outcome.description: Time to onset with loss of HBeAg in serum collected by blood draw was summarized using the Kaplan-Meier method.: CLIA method. Regarding the Measured Values, the median time to onset and its lower limit and its upper limit for all groups are non-estimable because they are not observed until the end of the study.

outcome.title: Time to Onset of HBeAg/Ab Seroconversion
outcome.description: Time to onset of HBeAg/Ab seroconversion in serum collected by blood draw was summarized using the Kaplan-Meier method.: CLIA method. Regarding the Measured Values, the median time to onset and its lower limit and its upper limit for all groups are non-estimable because they are not observed until the end of the study.

outcome.title: Mean Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Level at Week 52
outcome.description: Summary statistics were displayed for serum ALT.

group.title: Adefovir (ADV)
group.description: ADV 10 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

group.title: Lamivudine (LAM)
group.description: LAM 100 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

measure.title: Mean Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Level at Week 52
measure.description: Summary statistics were displayed for serum ALT.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Normalization at Week 52
outcome.description: ALT normalization was defined as an ALT value that was in the normal range (<= 45IU/L; upper limit of normal [ULN]) at Week 52 of the participants whose ALT values were abnormal (>45IU/L) at baseline
outcome.population: PPS: Participants with an abnormal ALT value (>ULN) at baseline

group.title: Adefovir (ADV)
group.description: ADV 10 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

group.title: Lamivudine (LAM)

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Normalization at Week 52
measure.description: ALT normalization was defined as an ALT value that was in the normal range (<= 45IU/L; upper limit of normal [ULN]) at Week 52 of the participants whose ALT values were abnormal (>45IU/L) at baseline
measure.population: PPS: Participants with an abnormal ALT value (>ULN) at baseline

outcome.title: Time to Onset of ALT Normalization
outcome.description: Time to onset of ALT normalization was summarized using the Kaplan-Meier method.
outcome.population: PPS: Participants with abnormal ALT value (>ULN) at baseline

outcome.title: Rate of Emergence of Resistant Virus at Week 52
outcome.description: Participants with resistant mutation at Week 52. LAM resistant mutation (enzyme-linked mini-sequencing assay): rtM204I/V; ADV resistant mutation (direct sequencing assay): rtN236T or rtA181T/V in HBV DNA ; rt: reverse transcriptase gene

group.description: ADV 10 mg orally once daily for 52 weeks

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
